verses.verse: And he went <S%G1831><s%> out from there, <S%G1564><s%> and came <S%G2064><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> his own country; <S%G3968><s%> and his disciples <S%G3101><s%> follow <S%G190><s%> him.

And when the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day was come, <S%G1096><s%> he began <S%G756><s%> to teach <S%G1321><s%> in the synagogue: <S%G4864><s%> and many <S%G4183><s%> hearing <S%G191><s%> him were astonished, <S%G1605><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> From where <S%G4159><s%> has this <S%G5129><s%> man these <S%G5023><s%> things? and what <S%G5101><s%> wisdom <S%G4678><s%> is this <S%G3588><s%> which is given <S%G1325><s%> to him, that even <S%G2532><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> mighty <S%G1411><s%> works are worked <S%G1096><s%> by his hands? <S%G5495><s%>

Is not this <S%G3778><s%> the carpenter, <S%G5045><s%> the son <S%G5207><s%> of Mary, <S%G3137><s%> the brother <S%G80><s%> of James, <S%G2385><s%> and Joses, <S%G2500><s%> and of Juda, <S%G2455><s%> and Simon? <S%G4613><s%> and are not his sisters <S%G79><s%> here <S%G5602><s%> with us? And they were offended <S%G4624><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> him.

But Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, A prophet <S%G4396><s%> is not without <S%G820><s%> honor, <S%G820><s%> but in his own country, <S%G3968><s%> and among <S%G1722><s%> his own kin, <S%G4773><s%> and in his own house. <S%G3614><s%>

And he could <S%G1410><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> mighty <S%G1411><s%> work, <S%G1411><s%> save <S%G1508><s%> that he laid <S%G2007><s%> his hands <S%G5495><s%> on a few <S%G3641><s%> sick <S%G732><s%> folk, and healed <S%G2323><s%> them.

And he marveled <S%G2296><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> of their unbelief. <S%G570><s%> And he went <S%G4013><s%> round <S%G2943><s%> about <S%G2945><s%> the villages, <S%G2968><s%> teaching. <S%G1321><s%>

And he called <S%G4341><s%> to him the twelve, <S%G1427><s%> and began <S%G756><s%> to send <S%G649><s%> them forth <S%G1614><s%> by two <S%G1417><s%> and two; <S%G1417><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> them power <S%G1849><s%> over unclean <S%G169><s%> spirits; <S%G4151><s%>

And commanded <S%G3853><s%> them that they should take <S%G142><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> for their journey, <S%G3598><s%> save <S%G1508><s%> a staff <S%G4464><s%> only; <S%G3440><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> money, <S%G4082><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> bread, <S%G740><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> money <S%G5475><s%> in their purse: <S%G2223><s%>
But be shod <S%G5265><s%> with sandals; <S%G4547><s%> and not put <S%G1746><s%> on <S%G1746><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> coats. <S%G5509><s%>

And he said <S%G3004><s%> to them, In what <S%G3699><s%> place <S%G3699><s%> soever <S%G1437><s%> you enter <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> an house, <S%G3614><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> you depart <S%G1831><s%> from that place. <S%G1564><s%>

And whoever <S%G3745><s%> <S%G302><s%> shall not receive <S%G1209><s%> you, nor <S%G3366><s%> hear <S%G191><s%> you, when you depart <S%G1607><s%> there, <S%G1564><s%> shake <S%G1621><s%> off <S%G1621><s%> the dust <S%G5522><s%> under <S%G5270><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> feet <S%G4228><s%> for a testimony <S%G3142><s%> against them. Truly <S%G281><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, It shall be more <S%G414><s%> tolerable <S%G414><s%> for Sodom <S%G4670><s%> and Gomorrha <S%G1116><s%> in the day <S%G2250><s%> of judgment, <S%G2920><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> for that city. <S%G4172><s%>
And they went <S%G1831><s%> out, and preached <S%G2784><s%> that men should repent. <S%G3340><s%>

And they cast <S%G1544><s%> out many <S%G4183><s%> devils, <S%G1140><s%> and anointed <S%G218><s%> with oil <S%G1637><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> that were sick, <S%G732><s%> and healed <S%G2323><s%> them.

And king <S%G935><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of him; (for his name <S%G3686><s%> was spread <S%G5318><s%> abroad: <S%G1519><s%> <S%G1096><s%>) and he said, <S%G3004><s%> That John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist <S%G907><s%> was risen <S%G1453><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and therefore <S%G1223><s%> <S%G5124><s%> mighty <S%G1411><s%> works do show <S%G1754><s%> forth <S%G1754><s%> themselves in him.

Others <S%G243><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> That it is Elias. <S%G2243><s%> And others <S%G243><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> That it is a prophet, <S%G4396><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> as one <S%G1520><s%> of the prophets. <S%G4396><s%>

But when Herod <S%G2264><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> thereof, he said, <S%G2036><s%> It is John, <S%G2491><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I beheaded: <S%G607><s%> he is risen <S%G1453><s%> from the dead. <S%G3498><s%>

For Herod <S%G2264><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> had sent <S%G649><s%> forth <S%G1614><s%> and laid hold <S%G2902><s%> on John, <S%G2491><s%> and bound <S%G1210><s%> him in prison <S%G5438><s%> for Herodias' <S%G2266><s%> sake, his brother <S%G80><s%> Philip's <S%G5376><s%> wife: <S%G1135><s%> for he had married <S%G1060><s%> her.
For John <S%G2491><s%> had said <S%G3004><s%> to Herod, <S%G2264><s%> It is not lawful <S%G1832><s%> for you to have <S%G2192><s%> your brother's <S%G80><s%> wife. <S%G1135><s%>
Therefore Herodias <S%G2266><s%> had a quarrel <S%G1758><s%> against him, and would <S%G2309><s%> have killed <S%G615><s%> him; but she could <S%G1410><s%> not:

For Herod <S%G2264><s%> feared <S%G5399><s%> John, <S%G2491><s%> knowing <S%G1492><s%> that he was a just <S%G1342><s%> man <S%G435><s%> and an holy, <S%G40><s%> and observed <S%G4933><s%> him; and when he heard <S%G191><s%> him, he did <S%G4160><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> things, and heard <S%G191><s%> him gladly. <S%G2234><s%>

And when a convenient <S%G2121><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> was come, <S%G1096><s%> that Herod <S%G2264><s%> on his birthday <S%G1077><s%> made <S%G4160><s%> a supper <S%G1173><s%> to his lords, <S%G3175><s%> high <S%G5310><s%> captains, <S%G5506><s%> and chief <S%G4413><s%> estates of Galilee; <S%G1056><s%>

And when the daughter <S%G2364><s%> of the said <S%G846><s%> Herodias <S%G2266><s%> came <S%G1525><s%> in, and danced, <S%G3738><s%> and pleased <S%G700><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> and them that sat <S%G4873><s%> with him, the king <S%G935><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to the damsel, <S%G2877><s%> Ask <S%G154><s%> of me whatever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you will, <S%G2309><s%> and I will give <S%G1325><s%> it you.
And he swore <S%G3660><s%> to her, Whatever <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> you shall ask <S%G154><s%> of me, I will give <S%G1325><s%> it you, to the half <S%G2255><s%> of my kingdom. <S%G932><s%>

And she went <S%G1831><s%> forth, <S%G1831><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> to her mother, <S%G3384><s%> What <S%G5101><s%> shall I ask? <S%G154><s%> And she said, <S%G2036><s%> The head <S%G2776><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist. <S%G910><s%>

And she came <S%G1525><s%> in straightway <S%G2112><s%> with haste <S%G4710><s%> to the king, <S%G935><s%> and asked, <S%G154><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> I will <S%G2309><s%> that you give <S%G1325><s%> me by and by in a charger <S%G4094><s%> the head <S%G2776><s%> of John <S%G2491><s%> the Baptist. <S%G910><s%>

And the king <S%G935><s%> was exceeding <S%G4036><s%> sorry; <S%G4036><s%> yet for his oath's <S%G3727><s%> sake, and for their sakes which <S%G3588><s%> sat <S%G4873><s%> with him, he would <S%G2309><s%> not reject <S%G114><s%> her.

And immediately <S%G2112><s%> the king <S%G935><s%> sent <S%G649><s%> an executioner, <S%G4688><s%> and commanded <S%G2004><s%> his head <S%G2776><s%> to be brought: <S%G5342><s%> and he went <S%G565><s%> and beheaded <S%G607><s%> him in the prison, <S%G5438><s%>

And brought <S%G5342><s%> his head <S%G2776><s%> in a charger, <S%G4094><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> it to the damsel: <S%G2877><s%> and the damsel <S%G2877><s%> gave <S%G1325><s%> it to her mother. <S%G3384><s%>
And when his disciples <S%G3101><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of it, they came <S%G2064><s%> and took <S%G142><s%> up his corpse, <S%G4430><s%> and laid <S%G5087><s%> it in a tomb. <S%G3419><s%>

And the apostles <S%G652><s%> gathered <S%G4863><s%> themselves together <S%G4863><s%> to Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> and told <S%G518><s%> him all <S%G3956><s%> things, both <S%G5037><s%> what <S%G3745><s%> they had done, <S%G4160><s%> and what <S%G3745><s%> they had taught. <S%G2258><s%> <S%G1321><s%>

And he said <S%G2036><s%> to them, Come <S%G1205><s%> you yourselves <S%G5210><s%> <S%G846><s%> apart <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2398><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> a desert <S%G2048><s%> place, <S%G5117><s%> and rest <S%G373><s%> a while: <S%G3641><s%> for there were many <S%G4183><s%> coming <S%G2064><s%> and going, <S%G5217><s%> and they had no <S%G3761><s%> leisure <S%G2119><s%> so <S%G3761><s%> much as to eat. <S%G5315><s%>
And they departed <S%G565><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> a desert <S%G2048><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> by ship <S%G4143><s%> privately. <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2398><s%>

And the people <S%G3793><s%> saw <S%G1492><s%> them departing, <S%G5217><s%> and many <S%G4183><s%> knew <S%G1921><s%> him, and ran <S%G4936><s%> afoot <S%G3979><s%> thither <S%G1563><s%> out of all <S%G3956><s%> cities, <S%G4172><s%> and preceded <S%G4281><s%> them, and came <S%G4905><s%> together <S%G4905><s%> to him.

And Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> when he came <S%G1831><s%> out, saw <S%G1492><s%> much <S%G4183><s%> people, <S%G3793><s%> and was moved <S%G4697><s%> with compassion <S%G4697><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> them, because <S%G3754><s%> they were as sheep <S%G4263><s%> not having <S%G2192><s%> a shepherd: <S%G4166><s%> and he began <S%G756><s%> to teach <S%G1321><s%> them many <S%G4183><s%> things.

And when the day <S%G5610><s%> was now <S%G2235><s%> far <S%G4183><s%> spent, his disciples <S%G3101><s%> came <S%G4334><s%> to him, and said, <S%G3004><s%> This <S%G3588><s%> is a desert <S%G2048><s%> place, <S%G5117><s%> and now <S%G2235><s%> the time <S%G5610><s%> is far <S%G4183><s%> passed:

Send <S%G630><s%> them away, <S%G630><s%> that they may go <S%G565><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the country <S%G68><s%> round <S%G2943><s%> about, <S%G2945><s%> and into <S%G1519><s%> the villages, <S%G2968><s%> and buy <S%G59><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> bread: <S%G740><s%> for they have <S%G2192><s%> nothing <S%G3756><s%> <S%G5100><s%> to eat. <S%G5315><s%>

He answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> to them, Give <S%G1325><s%> you them to eat. <S%G5315><s%> And they say <S%G3004><s%> to him, Shall we go <S%G565><s%> and buy <S%G59><s%> two <S%G1250><s%> hundred <S%G1250><s%> pennyworth <S%G1220><s%> of bread, <S%G740><s%> and give <S%G1325><s%> them to eat? <S%G5315><s%>

He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, How <S%G4214><s%> many <S%G4214><s%> loaves <S%G740><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> you? go <S%G5217><s%> and see. <S%G1492><s%> And when they knew, <S%G1097><s%> they say, <S%G3004><s%> Five, <S%G4002><s%> and two <S%G1417><s%> fishes. <S%G2486><s%>
And he commanded <S%G2004><s%> them to make <S%G347><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> sit <S%G347><s%> down <S%G347><s%> by companies <S%G4849><s%> on the green <S%G5515><s%> grass. <S%G5528><s%>
And they sat <S%G377><s%> down <S%G377><s%> in ranks, <S%G4237><s%> by hundreds, <S%G1540><s%> and by fifties. <S%G4004><s%>

And when he had taken <S%G2983><s%> the five <S%G4002><s%> loaves <S%G740><s%> and the two <S%G1417><s%> fishes, <S%G2486><s%> he looked <S%G308><s%> up to heaven, <S%G3772><s%> and blessed, <S%G2127><s%> and broke <S%G2622><s%> the loaves, <S%G740><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> them to his disciples <S%G3101><s%> to set <S%G3908><s%> before <S%G3908><s%> them; and the two <S%G1417><s%> fishes <S%G2486><s%> divided <S%G3307><s%> he among them all. <S%G3956><s%>
And they did all <S%G3956><s%> eat, <S%G5315><s%> and were filled. <S%G5526><s%>
And they took <S%G142><s%> up twelve <S%G1427><s%> baskets <S%G2894><s%> full <S%G4134><s%> of the fragments, <S%G2801><s%> and of the fishes. <S%G2486><s%>
And they that did eat <S%G5315><s%> of the loaves <S%G740><s%> were about <S%G5616><s%> five <S%G4000><s%> thousand <S%G4000><s%> men. <S%G435><s%>

And straightway <S%G2112><s%> he constrained <S%G315><s%> his disciples <S%G3101><s%> to get <S%G1684><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the ship, <S%G4143><s%> and to go <S%G4254><s%> to the other <S%G4008><s%> side <S%G4008><s%> before <S%G4254><s%> to Bethsaida, <S%G966><s%> while <S%G2193><s%> he sent <S%G630><s%> away <S%G630><s%> the people. <S%G3793><s%>
And when he had sent <S%G657><s%> them away, <S%G657><s%> he departed <S%G565><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> a mountain <S%G3735><s%> to pray. <S%G4336><s%>

And when even <S%G3798><s%> was come, <S%G1096><s%> the ship <S%G4143><s%> was in the middle <S%G3319><s%> of the sea, <S%G2281><s%> and he alone <S%G3441><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the land. <S%G1095><s%>

And he saw <S%G1492><s%> them toiling <S%G928><s%> in rowing; <S%G1643><s%> for the wind <S%G417><s%> was contrary <S%G1727><s%> to them: and about <S%G4012><s%> the fourth <S%G5067><s%> watch <S%G5438><s%> of the night <S%G3571><s%> he comes <S%G2064><s%> to them, walking <S%G4043><s%> on the sea, <S%G2281><s%> and would <S%G2309><s%> have passed <S%G3928><s%> by them.
But when they saw <S%G1492><s%> him walking <S%G4043><s%> on the sea, <S%G2281><s%> they supposed <S%G1380><s%> it had been <S%G1511><s%> a spirit, <S%G5326><s%> and cried <S%G349><s%> out:

For they all <S%G3956><s%> saw <S%G1492><s%> him, and were troubled. <S%G5015><s%> And immediately <S%G2112><s%> he talked <S%G2980><s%> with them, and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, Be of good cheer: <S%G2293><s%> it is I; be not afraid. <S%G5399><s%>

And he went <S%G305><s%> up to them into <S%G1519><s%> the ship; <S%G4143><s%> and the wind <S%G417><s%> ceased: <S%G2869><s%> and they were sore <S%G3029><s%> amazed <S%G1839><s%> in themselves <S%G1438><s%> beyond <S%G1537><s%> <S%G4053><s%> measure, <S%G4053><s%> and wondered. <S%G2296><s%>
For they considered <S%G4920><s%> not the miracle of the loaves: <S%G740><s%> for their heart <S%G2588><s%> was hardened. <S%G4456><s%>

And when they had passed <S%G1276><s%> over, <S%G1276><s%> they came <S%G2064><s%> into <S%G1909><s%> the land <S%G1095><s%> of Gennesaret, <S%G1082><s%> and drew <S%G4358><s%> to the shore. <S%G4358><s%>
And when they were come <S%G1831><s%> out of the ship, <S%G4143><s%> straightway <S%G2112><s%> they knew <S%G1921><s%> him,

And ran <S%G4063><s%> through <S%G4063><s%> that whole <S%G3650><s%> region <S%G4066><s%> round <S%G4066><s%> about, <S%G4066><s%> and began <S%G756><s%> to carry <S%G4064><s%> about <S%G4064><s%> in beds <S%G2895><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> that were sick, <S%G2192><s%> <S%G2560><s%> where <S%G3699><s%> they heard <S%G191><s%> he was.

And wherever <S%G3699><s%> <S%G302><s%> he entered, <S%G1531><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> villages, <S%G2968><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> cities, <S%G4172><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> country, <S%G68><s%> they laid <S%G5087><s%> the sick <S%G770><s%> in the streets, <S%G58><s%> and sought <S%G3870><s%> him that they might touch <S%G680><s%> if <S%G2579><s%> it were but the border <S%G2899><s%> of his garment: <S%G2440><s%> and as many <S%G3745><s%> as touched <S%G680><s%> him were made <S%G4982><s%> whole. <S%G4982><s%>
